You should see our FAQ pages:

https://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/crawl+rate+considerations

...and especially...

https://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/unexpectedly+slow+crawling+on+idle+crawler

I've just added additional explanation to the latter page about the 
factors relevant to a queue like in your example, in a many-minutes 
retry cycle.

If a site you can visit with your desktop browser is showing that retry 
cycle from your crawler, the crawler machine may have been blocked from 
accessing the site. Resolving that, or deciding to end the crawl because 
it's no longer making any progress, may be more helpful than adjusting 
other parameters.

- Gordon @ IA

t.schoellhorn wrote:
> Hi,
> 
> we are using H3 to crawl "Snapshots" of specific websites. As we are running the crawls I noticed that at the "end" of crawl (i.e. when there are only a few queues left in the frontier) there are a lot of "snoozing" (inactive?) queues. Those queues wait 5 to 15 min until they start to be active again. 
> 
> For example: 
> Queue de,spiegel,www, (p1)
>   85306 items
>    wakes in: 11m44s547ms
>     last enqueued: http://www.spiegel.de/wikipedia/Gregor_Gysi.html
>       last peeked: http://www.spiegel.de/wikipedia/Gregor_Gysi.html
>    total expended: 23292 (total budget: -1)
>    active balance: -7950
>    last(avg) cost: 1(1)
> 
> How can we change that behaviour so that our jobs finish faster?
> 
> Cheers,
> Tino
>   
> 
>
